item.title: COLLABORATION
item.description: Levels of collaboration Talkers - People who just give verbal feedback Contributor - can contribute content but not edit the website Editor - can contribute AND edit website Collaboration Roles Guests Facilitator Core Member TO DISCUSS Should all core members have to edit the website and use all the tools? Responsibilities FACILITATOR invite Guests and Members make sure every has access to all tools/ permissions needed to fully participate ensure Members and Guests attend as appropriate provide everyone with a clear scope of the project GUESTS attend participate access tools/ permissions needed to fully participate MEMBERS attend participate access tools/ permissions needed to fully participate attend What does an onboarded GUEST look like?

item.title: Soundboard
item.description: how to request a soundboard copy soundboard template create new note and title it answer questions, add any other relevant infoemation change permissions to everyone (ask group if confused) share it with praxis signal group for consideration ] how to prepare a public soundboard decide on a date add date to praxis calendar add hackmd note link to calendar create zoom link (ask camille), add date and zoom link on note promote note with date on mastodon how to announce a soundboard to outsiders what’s praxis what’s soundboard what’s this soundboard (topic, format, desired goals can) soundboard debrief how to prepare for a private soundboard pending

item.title: The State of Praxis 2023
item.description: Praxis is a fuzzy cloud, a portal to the stars, an epic twirl in the middle of the dancefloor. Praxis has taken many forms over the past 6 years – book club, design collective, queens of the scene, think tank, and more – and as the year closes, we wanted to use this space to muse a bit about what we’ve been up to over the past year and where we are trying to go in the next.

item.title: Editing this website
item.description: Praxis uses Hugo framework and is hosted on Github pages. Pages are markdown + frontmatter on Any page under content folder will be visible on the website, using format: praxis.nyc/(folder name)/(filename minus .md) To edit pages you’ll need to: Learn markdown basics Create a gitlab account Inform team to be added to repo’s project members Visit Gitlab IDE to edit Ask around for content templates, so frontmatter is correct Commit all your changes (you’ll need a message) Troubleshooting:

item.title: commons.garden
item.description: Initial questions Where are you in your process? We just finished phase 1 with initial categories (spec, wireframe), and heading to phase 2, with people and organization categories, and better integration between categories. View phases list view categories draft What can I help you with the most? Is this a better way to track initiatives? Any other standards we could be using? How to communicate initiative’s status so others know where we stand?

item.title: Contact
item.description: For all inquiries contact us at praxis.nyc@protonmail.com We also offer a free design consulting session for open source projects, set a time here.

item.title: Mesa
item.description: What is Mesa -- Built upon a gesture library, Mesa provides an open-source AR environment for task-specific apps. Created with community use in mind, Mesa recognizes and responds to simultaneous actions of multiple users. Mesa is hardware-agnostic, allowing for comprehensive setup and calibration with easily found hardware: camera (input), projector (output) and a computer. Remote Work with Mesa -- Mesa brings a secure and synchronous whiteboard experience to collaborators across the world.

item.title: Cyborg series
item.description: An ad-hoc study series where we learn and debate extended cognition, new technologies and relevant theories to understand what’s ahead. We meet every other tuesday 6 PM EST. Signal group and notes board. Apr 18, 2023 7PM EST on jit.si Show and tell: Everything to Know About Artificial Intelligence, or AI (Article) The Augmented Commons: How Augmented Reality Aids Agile Self-Organization (Paper) Mar 7, 2023 A framework to contest and justify algorithmic decisions (paper), Dude, you broke the Future!

item.title: Panopticon
item.description: Discussing Shoshana Zuboff’s The Age of Surveillance Capitalism. We highly suggest you to listen to Shoshana’s talk at Data & Society (1:08 total, start at 5min). Panopticon session 1 Initial Talk Thursday 7/18/2018, 7 to 9pm Private space Relevant links (from our signal group): QR is King Mobile technology is increasingly serving as the vehicle for a sophisticated national surveillance system that’s deeply intertwined with all kinds of necessary everyday transactions.

item.title: Situated Cognition
item.description: Brainbound The (nonneural) body is just the sensor and effector system of the brain, and the world is just the arena in which adaptive problems get posed and in which the brain–body system must sense and act. All human cognition depends directly on neural activity alone. Extended Includes inextricable tangles of feedback, feed-forward, and feed-around loops: loops that promiscuously criss-cross the boundaries of brain, body, and world.

item.title: Hyperreal
item.description: This study circle met in Brooklyn every other Wednesday starting April 18 2018 for a total of five sessions. Dude, You Broke the Future Wednesday 4/18/2018, 7 to 9pm at June Bar Dude, You Broke the Future video, 57 minutes Simulacra and Simulation The Precession of Simulacra, page 3 The Divine Irreference of Images, page 4 Download PDF Society of Spectacle Wednesday 5/2/2018, 7 to 9pm at 375 Menahan Street Chapter 1: The Culmination of Separation Chapter 2: The Commodity as Spectacle Chapter 6: Spetacular Time download PDF The Work of Art in the Age of Mechanical Reproduction Wednesday 5/16/2018, 7 to 9pm at 375 Menahan Street Download PDF Understanding Media Wednesday 6/6/2018, 7 to 9pm at June Bar The Gadget Lover: Narcissus as Narcosis Challenge and Collapse: The Nemesis of Creativity Download PDF Immediatism, Hakim Bey Wednesday 7/19/2018, 7 to 9pm at Tradesman Bar Immediatism chapter (page 12) Download PDF Telekommunist Manifesto The Manifesto of the Telekommunisten Network Download PDF Simulacra and Simulation Hypermarket and Hypercommodity, page 52 The Implosion of Meaning in the Media, page 55 Simulacra and science fiction, page 81 Download PDF

item.title: Nimble-Ready Institutions
item.description: One of the main reasons organizations grow monolithic is to cut transaction costs. LLMs allows us to slash these cost, allowing them to stay lean, specialized, and agile—while still collaborating dynamically. This is a new kind of ecosystem, where institutions don’t just interact, they sense each other—like constellations in space—through handshake protocols and smart contracts. These protocols automate middle management, intelligently identifying: How organizations should collaborate (based on operational compatibility)
